means: Close Air Support System 近空支援系统
Capacity Loading and Scheduling System 容量装载与调度系统
Container-Lighters Aboard Ship System 集装箱-驳船船舶装运系统
Canberra Laboratories Automation Software System <美>堪培拉工业公司实验室自动化软件系统
[人名] 克拉斯
[电影]高材生
class ： 从"班级"引申指学生在一起上课，还可表示"(一节)课"。
lesson ： 主要指教材中的一课或每次授课的单位时间。
lecture ： 指讲课。
course ： 指在一段时间内教完或学完的完整的课程。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"级，等级"之意。
means: class ： 含义广泛，指人或物按优劣划分的等级，也指学校中的年级或班级。
degree ： 指程度、范围不同，社会地位的高低。也可指形容词或副词的级。
grade ： 指按地位或优劣划分的等级，既可指人又可指物。
rank ： 指人在社会中的地位或等级，尤指军队中的军衔。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"种，类，类型"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: kind, sort, type, class, classification, category, species, variety
means: kind ： 指性质相同，而且特征很相似，足以归为一类的人或东西。
sort ： 普通用词，文体较kind随便，指对人或对事物进行的大概分类，有时含贬义。
type ： 指客观界限比较清楚，有相同本质特点的同类事物，或指大致相似的同类事物。
class ： 正式用词，指门类、种类或优劣等级；用于指动植物的分类时，表示"纲"。
classification ： 指根据已经确定的类型对某一实物作鉴别和归类。
category ： 书面用词，特指有确切定义的群体。
species ： 书面用词，单复数同形。指生物分类上的种。
variety ： 强调有各自的特点，形式不同，品质不同的种类。

word_mean: 纲：分类学上的一级，在门(或亚门)下、目上
统计学上为表示一特定数值或区间值的一组变数。组频数为该组所含变数的数目

entry.def: A class is a group of pupils or students who are taught together.

example.ex: He had to spend about six months in a class with younger students...
example.tran: 他不得不和一群比他小的学生在一个班里上了约6个月的课。

example.ex: Reducing class sizes should be a top priority.
example.tran: 削减班级规模应该是首选方案。

entry.def: A class is a course of teaching in a particular subject.

example.ex: He acquired a law degree by taking classes at night...
example.tran: 他通过读夜校获得了法律学位。

example.ex: I go to dance classes here in New York.

entry.def: If you do something in class, you do it during a lesson in school.

example.ex: There is lots of reading in class.
example.tran: 课上要进行大量的阅读。

entry.def: The students in a school or university who finish their course in a particular year are often referred to as the class of that year.

example.ex: These two members of Yale's Class of '57 never miss a reunion.
example.tran: 这两个耶鲁大学57届毕业生每次同学聚会都参加。

entry.def: Class refers to the division of people in a society into groups according to their social status.

example.ex: What it will do is create a whole new ruling class.
example.tran: 它的作用就是创造一个全新的统治阶级。

entry.def: A class of things is a group of them with similar characteristics.

example.ex: Harbour staff noticed that measurements given for the same class of boats often varied.
example.tran: 港口工作人员注意到，对同一类船舶的测量方法常常不一样。

example.ex: ...the division of the stars into six classes of brightness.
example.tran: 按照亮度将恒星分为6个等级

entry.def: If someone or something is classed as a particular thing, they are regarded as belonging to that group of things.

example.ex: Since the birds interbreed they cannot be classed as different species...
example.tran: 由于这些鸟进行杂交繁殖，不能把它们归为不同的物种。

example.ex: I class myself as an ordinary working person...
example.tran: 我把自己当作一个普通的上班族。

entry.def: If you say that someone or something has class, you mean that they are elegant and sophisticated.

example.ex: He's got the same style off the pitch as he has on it — sheer class.
example.tran: 他场上场下都是一个样——极具风度。

entry.def: If you describe someone or something as a class person or thing, you mean that they are very good.

example.ex: Kite is undoubtedly a class player.
example.tran: 凯特绝对是个一流选手。

entry.def: If you say that someone such as a sports player or a performer is a class act, you mean that they are very good at what they do.
entry.tran: 出类拔萃的人物(指运动员、演奏者等)

entry.def: If someone is in a class of their own, they have more of a particular skill or quality than anyone else. If something is in a class of its own, it is better than any other similar thing.
entry.tran: 独领风骚的;独一无二的;出类拔萃的

example.ex: As a player, he was in a class of his own.
example.tran: 作为运动员，他是独一无二的。

means.word_mean: 1. people having the same social or economic status;
2. a body of students who are taught together;
3. education imparted in a series of lessons or class meetings;

sentences.sentence: "he took a course in basket weaving"
"flirting is not unknown in college classes"

means.word_mean: 4. a collection of things sharing a common attribute;
5. a body of students who graduate together;

sentences.sentence: "she was in my year at Hoehandle High"
"he played baseball in class D for two years"

means.word_mean: 8. (biology) a taxonomic group containing one or more orders
1. arrange or order by classes or categories;

sentences.sentence: "How would you classify these pottery shards--are they prehistoric?"

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in sense 3): from Latin classis' 'a division of the Roman people, a grade, or a class of pupils'
